import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import { common } from "../common/common"; // https://hackernoon.com/implement-form-validation-in-react-without-any-libraries const Register = () => { const lng = common.lng; const [username, setUsername] = useState(''); const [password, setPassword] = useState(''); const [password2, setPassword2] = useState(''); const [realname, setRealname] = useState(''); const [email, setEmail] = useState(''); const [avatar, setAvatar] = useState(''); const [twofactor, setTwofactor] = useState('0'); const [accept, setAccept] = useState('0'); const validator = (e:React.FormEvent) => { e.preventDefault(); // stop the submission const formElement = e.target as HTMLFormElement; // form validator // ha j贸 formElement.submit(); return; // ha nem j贸 // common.popupMsg('form invalid'); // return; } return (

  { lng('REGISTRATION') }

setUsername(e.target.value) } required className="form-control" />
setPassword(e.target.value) } />
setPassword2(e.target.value) }/>
setRealname(e.target.value) }/>
setEmail(e.target.value) }/>
{ lng('AVATARFILE') }
setAvatar(e.target.value) }/>
setAccept(e.target.value) }/> { lng('POLICYACCEPT') }
; { lng('POLICY') }

{ lng('REGISTHELP') }

{ lng('REGISTHELP2') }
) } export default Register
